crib_f1: Items Ranked at Highest Extreme
text: It is important to vote for leaders who will combat climate change.
com_f1: (With s8): Climate change is a real threat, leadership is required

crib_f1: Items Ranked Higher in this Factor Array than in Other Factor Arrays
text: Climate change is a threat to the health and safety of our children.
com_f1: (With s1): CC mitigation protects children. Future society has value.

crib_f1: Items Ranked Higher in this Factor Array than in Other Factor Arrays
text: The Great Barrier Reef is at risk from climate change.
com_f1: Congruent with CC is real, threatening, and is already impacting society.

crib_f1: Items Ranked Higher in this Factor Array than in Other Factor Arrays
text: The threat of climate change is much worse than climate scientists originally thought.
com_f1: (With 1 and qual. comments from 1). CC is seen to have devastating consequences. Leadership is a moral and ethical obligation. In general, leaders should be making the 'tough' decisions, but failing to do so. Some qual. comments indicate corruption/vested interest.

crib_f1: Items Ranked Higher in this Factor Array than in Other Factor Arrays
text: The increased occurrence of extreme weather events is a clear sign that climate change is real.
com_f1: (with 13): CC is real, and worse than people thought

crib_f1: Items Ranked Higher in this Factor Array than in Other Factor Arrays
text: Australia is experiencing more extreme weather and hotter days due to climate change.
com_f1: CC is having real, immediate impacts

crib_f1: Items Ranked Higher in this Factor Array than in Other Factor Arrays
text: Climate change policy and renewable energy (e.g., solar power) should be a major focus of Australian political elections.
com_f1: Emphasis for the need for leaders to mitigate CC, renewables are a co-benefit, not focus.

crib_f1: Items Ranked Higher in this Factor Array than in Other Factor Arrays
text: Poor people will be impacted the worst by climate change.
com_f1: Emphasise more holistic impacts [8] rather than disparity of impacts. Emphasise the intergenerational disparity [8]

crib_f1: Items Ranked Higher in this Factor Array than in Other Factor Arrays
text: Climate change sceptics ignore basic climate science facts.
com_f1: CC science is solid and damning, climate change sceptics do not understand the fundamentals.

crib_f1: Items Ranked Higher in this Factor Array than in Other Factor Arrays
text: Through cutting science funding, we damage Australia's ability to respond to climate change.
com_f1: Combine with [1], leaders shouldn't cut science funding

crib_f1: Items Ranked Higher in this Factor Array than in Other Factor Arrays
text: Politicians who refuse to tackle climate change are just as bad as those who deny climate science.
com_f1: Belief matter to the extent of action. The endorsement of 'bad' reflects the moral obligations of protection.

crib_f1: Items Ranked Higher in this Factor Array than in Other Factor Arrays
text: Politicians and the mass media are ignorant about the risks of climate change.
com_f1: But not as ignorant as sceptics [10]

crib_f1: Items Ranked Higher in this Factor Array than in Other Factor Arrays
text: People who deny the science of climate change should not hold public office.
com_f1: (With s1): Belief of leaders doesn't matter as much as action. Given its ranking relative to other profiles, indicates climate sceptics are at least seen in a negative light. Possibily seen as a risk to lack of CC action?

crib_f1: Items Ranked Lower in this Factor Array than in Other Factor Arrays
text: Australian politicians need to wake up to the emergency of tackling climate change.
com_f1: Despite [1] being the most salient, this statement falls within the middle of the distribution. The use of 'emergency' here may be offputing

crib_f1: Items Ranked Lower in this Factor Array than in Other Factor Arrays
text: No political party can say they have a climate change action plan when they favour coal, oil, and gas companies.
com_f1: Perhaps a reluctance to disagree with the mutually exclusive categorisation of this statement.

crib_f1: Items Ranked Lower in this Factor Array than in Other Factor Arrays
text: It is shameful that climate change, the greatest problem of our time, is barely discussed in the media.
com_f1: Similar to media [29]

crib_f1: Items Ranked Lower in this Factor Array than in Other Factor Arrays
text: Countries must fulfil their Paris Climate Agreement goals.
com_f1: Generally, it appears -1 is still an endorsed category, but just less salient than the positive categories. Once again, specific actions are not as salient

crib_f1: Items Ranked Lower in this Factor Array than in Other Factor Arrays
text: Regardless of who is elected, the reality is that climate change is going to destroy everything.
com_f1: This statement is not as salient as others, perhaps as politicians have some sway on our future [1]. The notion of an emergency is not a salient aspect [30]

crib_f1: Items Ranked Lower in this Factor Array than in Other Factor Arrays
text: Oil and gas companies could not care less about climate change.
com_f1: Similar to media [26]

crib_f1: Items Ranked Lower in this Factor Array than in Other Factor Arrays
text: Scientists should stop falsely claiming that climate change is a settled science.
com_f1: The science is settled [5], and worse than scientists originally thought [13]

crib_f1: Items Ranked Lower in this Factor Array than in Other Factor Arrays
text: They changed the name from "global warming" to "climate change" because the planet isn't warming.
com_f1: Alongside [13], indicates CC is occuring and warming the world

crib_f1: Items Ranked Lower in this Factor Array than in Other Factor Arrays
text: Cow farts cause more 'climate change' than human activity.
com_f1: Humans play an important rule

crib_f1: Items Ranked Lower in this Factor Array than in Other Factor Arrays
text: Those who demand climate action are the usual "torch-and-pitchfork" crowd.
com_f1: Viewpoint reflects the need for CC action, do not identify themselves as a 'torch-and-pitchfork' crowd

crib_f1: Items Ranked Lower in this Factor Array than in Other Factor Arrays
text: The concept of global warming was created by and for the Chinese in order to make U.S. manufacturing non-competitive.
com_f1: Similar to [3]

crib_f1: Items Ranked Lower in this Factor Array than in Other Factor Arrays
text: Australian agriculture is thriving so climate change can't be real.
com_f1: (Combined with s15 & s17): CC is likely negatively impacting agriculture. Other statements (e.g., s2) indicate CC is real.

crib_f1: Items Ranked at Lowest Extreme
text: Climate change is a hoax perpetrated by the United Nations.
com_f1: Qualitative comments reveal Ps found this statement absurd. Not only is CC real (1), the idea that the UN would manufacture the phenomenon is insulting.

crib_f1: Not on Crib Sheet
text: We must start working together for real solutions on climate change.
com_f1: But it's policitians [1] who must take charge

crib_f1: Not on Crib Sheet
text: Climate sceptics, with no genuine expertise, cannot know better than climate scientists.
com_f1: Climate scientists are not an unchallengable elite

crib_f1: Not on Crib Sheet
text: Climate change and human burning of fossil fuels are strongly linked.
com_f1: Impacts [8, 12, 13, 15, 17] are more salient than specific causal mechanisms

crib_f1: Not on Crib Sheet
text: We need to keep coal, oil, and gas in the ground and adopt more renewable energy sources, like solar and wind power.
com_f1: Impacts [8, 12, 13, 15, 17] are more salient than specific policies.Maybe not seen as necessarily exclusive categories. As with [30], specific disruptions are not endorsed. Rather, shifting the election focus [1,19] is more salient.
